overview_of_class: Social epistemology is the study of the social dimensions of knowledge. In this course we will examine central issues in this area of philosophy with special focus on how to understand the knowledge attributed to groups (such as corporations and universities), what norms govern our assessment of the credibility of others, the extent to which people can be the victims of testimonial injustice, and the role that ignorance plays in epistemic culpability.
name: Topics in Metaphysics and Epistemology
subject: PHIL
